title: Projects
desc: A collection of my best GitHub projects.

items.title: Van Drivers
items.desc: A web application (Node, AngularJS, MongoDB) that I created to better organize van scheduling for my university's climbing team. The application is deployed on Heroku and integrates into our team's Slack channel.

items.title: Neural Network
items.desc: This project was an exploration into machine learning I built after watching Google's AlphaGo domninate at Go using deep neural networks. This simple Python network has one hidden layer and can be applied to a variety of numerical datasets.

items.title: Raspberry Pi Photo Booth
items.desc: This project turns a Raspberry Pi into a home photo booth. The Pi runs a web server that tells the Pi to take a photo whenever a particular route is hit, then serve the photo in an HTTP response. This allows users to visit the Pi's internal IP address from their phones when on the same network and view the photo back on their phone immediately.

items.title: New Hampshire Wildlife Guide
items.desc: A project that first scrapes wildlife information and photographs from the internet using Python, then assembles the scraped data into a PDF using Lua and LaTeX. I made this to learn about web scraping and as a gift for my university's outdoor's club.

title: Skills
desc: Technologies I enjoy and have experience with.

items.title: Javascript
items.desc: I've used Javascript to develop web applications in profressional environments (WHOOP, MITRE) in conjunction with Node.js, React, and AngularJS. I enjoy using Javascript when starting up new projects for its lightweight syntax and flexible interpretation.

items.title: Python
items.desc: My favorite language and my go-to choice for most non-web-application projects. I've been writing Python since highschool and have used it most recently developing internal tools at WHOOP.

items.title: Java
items.desc: My experience with Java comes from writing Android applications and university courses. I love using Java when working with multiple people because of its clear and verbose syntax. Designing object relationships using extension and interfacing is also undeniably satisfying when many working with many related objects.

items.title: HTML, CSS, SASS
items.desc: I've become comfortable with these front-end technologies at both WHOOP and MITRE. When working on any front-end, I enjoy the concrete, visual result that always comes from the work.

items.title: Bash, Vim, Git
items.desc: With some occasional Googling, I know my way around Bash and the command line including writing code with Vim, SSHing into machines, and committing/merging/rebasing code with Git. I can grep but I'm not about whip out xargs without some serious thought.

items.title: C++, Racket
items.desc: Limited experience attained exclusively from university coursework.

items.title: WHOOP
items.desc: January - June 2017. Six month web developer co-op. Maintained and improved existing projects (AngularJS web application, marketing website, internal Python tools). Helped start new projects (web quiz to capture new e-mails, SVG conversion service). Represented a developer voice in meetings with product team.

items.title: MITRE
items.desc: January - June 2016. Six month web developer co-op. Created an admin web interface for a new project using AngularJS. Contributed features and fixes to existing suite of AngularJS web applications.

items.title: Liquid Planner
items.desc: June - August 2015. Three month Android developer internship. Ignited the upgrade of the Android application to the latest Gradle tools. Added new features and fixed bugs in existing Android application.
